text:
News Releases

Payroll employment rises by 227,000 in November; unemployment rate changes little at 4.2% Total nonfarm payroll employment rose by 227,000 in November, and the unemployment rate changed little at 4.2 percent. Employment trended up in health care, leisure and hospitality, government, and social assistance. Retail trade lost jobs.

| | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees are unchanged in November Real average hourly earnings for all employees were unchanged in November, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.4 percent, and CPI-U increased 0.3 percent. Real average weekly earnings increased 0.3 percent.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for December 2024 is scheduled to be released on January 10, 2025, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for December 2024 is scheduled to be released on January 15, 2025, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: CES (National) : U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics
